message: I have tried using the projectname/manage.py and it prints the same output

I have been using the cron section to try run management commands regularly, but I can't get it to work properly. Reading over console logs I can see it tries to run the command, but it doesn't display errors of any kind, and the task emits an email when run, which I never receive (and have tested manually). Basically...can you clarify that section, and make cron produce errors if it cannot run something (either mailed, or in the console)
It is highly probable that I am not using the right ini config, but couldn't do much debugging
Only set up cron in the last week, so don't have a reference. [cron] Running script u'manage.py what_are_you_syncing_about' (time is now 0 6 13 7 3)
@bradwhittington Is this recently? We've been having intermittent problems with the command-running, so it might be that instead
alright, I'll investigate in a bit

So, I had a look at your cron task, and it looks okay - however, I only pushed the new command-running code (which includes cron fixes) this morning, so it won't run on the new system till tomorrow morning
This started working yesterday morning, thanks...
This started working yesterday morning, thanks...
